comments.value:
We have commissioned a Flash feature for the Inspire hub page: http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/inspire-programme/index.php 

This is intended to be similar to the Flash feature we had on our 1000 days to go splash page, in which a number of photos with quotes on top appear. Photos and quotes will be edited by separate files.

Cogapp have produced this feature and the assets are attached. Is it possible to implement this on the Inspire hub page (but not push it live - I need to amend some of the files).

Thank you!
Forgot to say, you can see the slider in action here on the Cogapp project site: http://projects.cogapp.com/clients/LOCOG/html/flash_page2.html

Morag,

This page actually uses a template shared by lots of other pages and I assume you only want the flash on this page.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/index.php

Would you be OK with us creating a new page that we swap out for the existign one (you'll need to reassign things like promos, but guess your going to do that anyway?)

Hi Jamie, yes, that is absolutely fine - thanks!

 

________________________________

Lars can you pick this up, 

I have so far:

1) Created a new inspire hub page / template (this needs to be swapped for the current hub page once Morag is ready to go live and the hide from nav box unticked)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/inspire-hub.php

2) I have created a '/flash' folder in 
/get-involved/inspire-programme/

3) This contains the bits that 2012 need to edit (flash/images folderand the flash/xml folder)

4) But I have uploaded the other files direct to the live server (web01) via FTP because:
   a) the contain underscores (which the CMS converts to underscores  on publication)
   b) the names are in camel caps (which the CMS flattens on publication)
   c) it's hard to upload deeply nested folders to the CMS

[** we should as BigButton/CogApp not to supply code like this in future and use lowercase names without underscores, in shallowly nested folders]

5) I have also added the CSS to the main.css 

6) I have also added the JS to load the flash header to the new Inspire hub template and modified it to fit the new paths / the live site.

*BUT* (STILL TO DO  / FIX !!)

1) The movie isn't showing - expect it's path issue?
2) The replacement (no flash) image has a black line round it messing up layout.
3) [*important*] LOCOG need to edit /flash/xml/textcopy.xml (which will be published out lowercase) but the slider is looking for a camel caps version (so you will need to update the Flash file)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/flash/xml/textcopy.xml

Have a look at the original email / attachment for instructions.

Can you test that it is working and that you can edit the XML file in the CMS *before* closing this ticket.

It will only work when published due to the JS assets not living in the CMS (seems to dangerous to convert all paths to lowercase with no underscores)

Can you keep track on what you do on this also think about feed back we can give to 3rd party that will streamline this sort of this in future, I will then add it to the 'CMS best practice' doc which Morag can then send onto agencies.

thanks

Jamie

[Lars read previous post]

But Morag,

We have notice something that will become a problem.

The file you need to edit is called textCopy.xml but when we publish this out of the CMS it wil be flattened to textcopy.xml (lowercase c) and so will never be picked up.

Would you be able to get the flash movie resupplied so it looks for textcopy.xml (not textCopy.xml)

Hope this isn't too inconvenient..

(if you don't need to update the slider thsi won't be a issue)

Jamie
I think the filename 'textCopy.xml' needs to be changed to lower-case in the actual flash? Then it should work fine!

Hi Morag,


This is ready to go....
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/inspire-programme/inspire-hub.php

*BUT*

The Flash movie needs to be pick up a XML file called textcopy.xml (not textCopy.xml) 

See previous comment(s) or let me know who to email.

thanks

Jamie

Hello

 

Just to let you know I am working on this - will ask Cogapp to update
the files and resupply.

 

Thanks!

 

Morag

 

________________________________

I have asked the designers about this and they have said: 


The quickest fix would be to rename the xml file with the capital C - is
there something prohibiting you doing this?


Is that the case or does it need to be resupplied?

________________________________

Thanks MOrag,


We know we can do that ;-) (laughs, /not at you/ but the mis-communication along the way and CoggApp thinking 'Are they stupid? Why don't thy just change the case?') the problem is he CMS flatterns the file names of any files it publishes so textCopy.xml becomes textcopy.xml once published.

Sorry it probably got lost in my overly long comment / my fault for not begin clear.

BUT! We think we might be able to get round this anyway with a Alias/Redirect anyway, just testing.

Jamie

Hi Morag,

OK got this to work !!

(but the workaround we implemented - using Alias at the web server level - is far from ideal; we just temporarily brought the live server down as a by product of trying to deploy it and for something like this is a real hack / overkill / added complexity)

Anyway, let me know when you want us to swap to using it as the real hub / index page.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/inspire-programme/inspire-hub.php

You can edit the XML file in the CMS
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/flash/xml/textcopy.xml

In future it would be good if we could get any files supplied for upload into the CMS to have:

- lowercase file names with no special characters (other than 0-9 and a dash) - this is important.
- associated assets ideally in a shallow directory structure, ideally one levels deep (in other words *not* a deeply nested folder structure, as although we can zip up all assets/images in a directory we can't deal with nested folders and so have to import each and every folder separately) - this is a nice to have.

thanks

Jamie

Will look into why more tags aren't coming though.

With regards to 'All' it's actually a bit of an odd Location tag (*) as there really isn't any point tagging something to 'All' It's effectively the same as not tagging it to anything. If your trying to represent things that happen 'out and about' or in the 'London Boroughs' then make a new free text tag to convey that (obv. we need to fix free text tags at the bottom of blogs for that to work)

* We added 'All' as a Location option as we sometimes use the same taxonomy to create pull down menus where it does makes sense, although if could remember all the places we had pull downs that I would take it out of the taxonomy and add it explicitly.

In the meantime unless you have a reason (and do let me know if you do, as I can't think of any) then don't tag pages to Location=All

Is this done?

comments.value: for user management stuff

Hi Liz, is this just a stub for the work we are already doing or something you and Danny have discussed separately?

The new work actually is pretty transparent to the user management screens, it kind of happens in the background via API's and all that shoudl happen is that there should be six mailing lists in Communicator that correspond to the 6 mailing lists (and a master on) that correspond to the 6 mailing lists in the CMS/UMS; the master list is an amalgamation of all lists (but this cannot be unsubbed form other than by unsubbing to all lists)

There is already a ticket about this http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/321 , but titled "Documentation: user data sharing between PostCMS and Communicator Corp" which discusses various approaches, so no harm in using this ticket as the base for the actual work (if that is what it is intended for).

We are actually very near complete on this, we're still waiting on a few things;

- exact list of fields
- clarification that only verified users are exported (we have already made a decision that this is the case so we can move on)
- permissions on Jano's account so he can send a test mail out.

thanks

Jamie

integration bit. That's why I raised a separate ticket.
